title: If there is a day to act on the Love in your soul it is today, it is this moment. ~Mike Dolan
head: Love

title: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings. ~Gustave Flaubert
head: Love

title: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread. ~Mother Teresa
head: Love

title: Love can only end in indifference. If it ends in hate, it hasn't ended. ~Robert Brault, rbrault.blogspot.com
head: Love

title: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love. ~Albert Einstein
head: Love

title: There is no surprise more magical than the surprise of being loved. It is God's finger on man's shoulder. ~Charles Morgan
head: Love

title: You have to walk carefully in the beginning of love; the running across fields into your lover's arms can only come later when you're sure they won't laugh if you trip. ~Jonathan Carroll
head: Love

title: Ah me! love can not be cured by herbs. ~Ovid
head: Love

title: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence. ~Erich Fromm
head: Love

title: Love has no desire but to fulfill itself. To melt and be like a running brook that sings its melody to the night. To wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving. ~Khalil Gibran
head: Love

title: Infatuation is when you think he's as sexy as Robert Redford, as smart as Henry Kissinger, as noble as Ralph Nader, as funny as Woody Allen, and as athletic as Jimmy Conners. Love is when you realize that he's as sexy as Woody Allen, as smart as Jimmy Connors, as funny as Ralph Nader, as athletic as Henry Kissinger and nothing like Robert Redford — but you'll take him anyway. ~Judith Viorst
head: Love

title: Love is only a dirty trick played on us to achieve continuation of the species. ~W. Somerset Maugham, A Writer's Notebook, 1949
head: Love

title: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward together in the same direction. ~Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, Wind, Sand and Stars, 1939, translated from French by Lewis Galantière
head: Love

title: When love is not madness, it is not love. ~Pedro Calderon de la Barca
head: Love

title: Let your love be like the misty rains, coming softly, but flooding the river. ~Malagasy Proverb
head: Love

title: Love is much like a wild rose, beautiful and calm, but willing to draw blood in its defense. ~Mark Overby
head: Love

title: Love is a symbol of eternity. It wipes out all sense of time, destroying all memory of a beginning and all fear of an end. ~Author Unknown
head: Love

title: Love — a wildly misunderstood although highly desirable malfunction of the heart which weakens the brain, causes eyes to sparkle, cheeks to glow, blood pressure to rise and the lips to pucker. ~Author Unknown
head: Love

title: Love is a sweet tyranny, because the lover endureth his torments willingly. ~Proverb
head: Love

title: The lover is a monotheist who knows that other people worship different gods but cannot himself imagine that there could be other gods. ~Theodor Reik, Of Love and Lust, 1957
head: Love

title: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit. ~Peter Ustinov
head: Love

title: Hate leaves ugly scars, love leaves beautiful ones. ~Mignon McLaughlin
head: Love

title: The art of love... is largely the art of persistence. ~Albert Ellis
head: Love

title: Love one another and you will be happy. It's as simple and as difficult as that. ~Michael Leunig
head: Love

title: Who would give a law to lovers? Love is unto itself a higher law. ~Boethius, The Consolation of Philosophy, A.D. 524
head: Love

title: Who, being loved, is poor? ~Oscar Wilde
head: Love

title: Love must be as much a light, as it is a flame. ~Henry David Thoreau
head: Love

title: To find someone who will love you for no reason, and to shower that person with reasons, that is the ultimate happiness. ~Robert Brault
head: Love

title: Without love, what are we worth? Eighty-nine cents! Eighty-nine cents worth of chemicals walking around lonely. ~Laurence Marks
head: Love

title: A baby is born with a need to be loved — and never outgrows it. ~Frank A. Clark
head: Love

title: Love is the condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own. ~Robert Heinlein
head: Love

title: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough. ~George Moore
head: Love

title: We loved with a love that was more than love. ~Edgar Allan Poe
head: Love

title: If I love you, what business is it of yours? ~Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
head: Love

title: We choose those we like; with those we love, we have no say in the matter. ~Mignon McLaughlin, The Neurotic's Notebook, 1960
head: Love

title: The ultimate test of a relationship is to disagree but to hold hands. ~Quoted by Alexandra Penney in Self
head: Love

title: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself. ~Jean Anouilh
head: Love

title: When a man is in love or in debt, someone else has the advantage. ~Bill Balance
head: Love

title: Anyone can be passionate, but it takes real lovers to be silly. ~Rose Franken
head: Love

title: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat. ~Ben Hecht
head: Love

title: Love is like dew that falls on both nettles and lilies. ~Swedish Proverb
head: Love

title: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident, a tight girdle, a higher tax bracket or a holding pattern over Philadelphia. ~Judith Viorst, Redbook, 1975
head: Love

title: Passion makes the world go round. Love just makes it a safer place. ~Ice T, The Ice Opinion, quoted in Reader's Digest, Quotable Quotes,
head: Love

title: Love is an ocean of emotions entirely surrounded by expenses. ~Lord Dewar
head: Love

title: Only in love are unity and duality not in conflict. ~Rabindranath Tagore
head: Love

title: It is astonishing how little one feels alone when one loves. ~John Bulwer
head: Love

title: You know you have found love when you can't find your way back. ~Robert Brault
head: Love

title: Love is an exploding cigar we willingly smoke. ~Lynda Barry
head: Love

title: Love cures people—both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it. ~Karl Menninger
head: Love

title: If grass can grow through cement, love can find you at every time in your life. ~Cher
head: Love

title: Love is staying up all night with a sick child — or a healthy adult. ~David Frost
head: Love

title: Love doesn't sit there like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all of the time, made new. ~Ursula K. Le Guin
head: Love

title: Love is not singular except in syllable. ~Marvin Taylor
head: Love

title: Love is the word used to label the sexual excitement of the young, the habituation of the middle-aged, and the mutual dependence of the old. ~John Ciardi
head: Love

title: People who are sensible about love are incapable of it. ~Douglas Yates
head: Love

title: Take away love and our earth is a tomb. ~Robert Browning
head: Love
